meta_title: UTI Credit Risk Fund Direct Growth - Groww
meta_desc: UTI Credit Risk Fund Direct Growth is Credit Risk Debt mutual fund with risk-reward rating of 4/10. It has track record of 11 years, with three year return of 12.03. Risk is Moderately High
scheme_name: UTI Credit Risk Fund Direct Growth
exit_load: For units in excess of 10% of the investment,1% will be charged for redemption within 365 days
description: The scheme is to generate reasonable income and capital appreciation by investing minimum of 65% of total assets in AA and below rated corporate bonds (excluding AA+ rated corporate bonds).
benchmark: CRISIL Credit Risk Debt B-II Index
benchmark_name: CRISIL Credit Risk Debt B-II Index

analysis.analysis_desc: 3Y annualised returns higher than category average by 2.7%

amc_info.name: UTI Mutual Fund
amc_info.address: UTI Tower, Plot C-1, GN Block,Banrda Kurla Complex, Bandra (East)  Mumbai 400051
amc_info.description: UTI Mutual Fund started their mutual fund on 01/02/2003 and its managing total assets of ₹1,50,669 Cr. Its ranked at 6 as per total assets at end of 30th Sep 2017.
amc_info.more_description: UTI Mutual Fund was carved out of the erstwhile Unit Trust of India as a SEBI registered mutual fund from 1 February 2003. The Unit Trust of India Act 1963 was repealed, paving way for the bifurcation of UTI into – Specified Undertaking of Unit Trust of India; and UTI Mutual Fund. UTI AMC, India’s most trusted Wealth creators and always has the interest of its investors in its heart. The AMC has completed 50 years as India’s leading Financial service institution and was a sole vehicle of capital market investment for Indian Citizens till the early 90’s. The institution has shown great resilience and has grown from strength to strength overcoming economic turbulence and global turnarounds. This AMC has contributed immensely to industrial and capital growth in the Indian market. It has led transformative initiatives like developmental financial institutions, rural outreach programs and financial products and services.

category_info.tax_impact: Returns are taxed as per your Income Tax slab.
category_info.description: Invest predominantly in Government Securities(minimum 80% of total assets). They are relatively more risky than the other debt funds due to fluctuating interest rates.

holdings.company_name: Small Industries Devp. Bank of India Ltd.

fund_manager_details.education: Mr. Nambiar is an MMS (Finance), CFA and FRM holder.
fund_manager_details.experience: Prior to joining UTI AMC in March 2008, he was a Fixed Income Analyst with CRISIL Research (January 2007 - March 2008) and a Fixed Income Trader with Eurex, LIFFE and CBOE Desk )(May 2005 - October 2006).

historic_exit_loads.note: For units in excess of 10% of the investment,1% will be charged for redemption within 365 days
Exit load of 5% if redeemed within 12 months.
Exit load of 1% if units in excess of 10% are redeemed or switched-out within 12 months
Exit load of 1% if redeemed within 365 days
Exit load of 3% if redeemed within 365 days, 2% if redeemed after 365 days to 730 days and 1% redeemed after 730 days to 1095 days
Exit load of 1.25% shall be charged if units are redeemed within 365 days from the date of allotment, 0.75% if redeemed after 365 days and within 548 days.
